fields.query:
title1 = 'Top 10 countries by land area'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-land_area')[:10]
data1 = [[o.name, o.land_area] for o in r]

title2 = 'Top 10 countries by population'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-population')[:10]
data2 = [[o.name, o.population] for o in r]
fields.description: Top 20 countries by land area and population

fields.title: Top N countries by land area and population with query form
fields.form:
class GraphForm(forms.Form):
    title = forms.CharField(min_length=3, max_length=80, label='Title')
    number_countries = forms.IntegerField(max_value=50, min_value=5,
                                          label='Number of countries')
fields.form_page:
Graph Form

Forms may be customized by first displaying a form and allowing the user to enter values to customize the form.

These values may be used on the graph page or used in the graph query.

You can put explanation text above the form to explain the parameters.

{% csrf_token %} {# Include the hidden fields #} {% for hidden in graphform.hidden_fields %} {{ hidden }} {% endfor %} {# Include the visible fields #} {% for field in graphform.visible_fields %} {% if field.errors%}
{{ field.errors }}
{% endif %}
{{ field.label_tag }}
{{ field }}
{% endfor %}

Likewise you can put any instructions or whatever after the form.

fields.title: Top N countries by land area and population with query form
fields.form:
class GraphForm(forms.Form):
    title = forms.CharField(min_length=3, max_length=80, label='Title')
    number_countries = forms.IntegerField(max_value=50, min_value=5,
                                          label='Number of countries')
    helper = FormHelper()
    helper.form_method = 'POST'
    helper.form_class = 'form-horizontal'
    helper.label_class = 'col-sm-2'
    helper.field_class = 'col-sm-10'
    helper.layout = Layout(
        Field('title', css_class='input-sm', placeholder='The title for the graph page.'),
        #PrependedText('number_countries', '#', 
        #    css_class='input-sm',  wrapper_class='col-xs-2',
        #    placeholder='The number of countries to show'),
        Field('number_countries', css_class='input-sm col-xs-2', placeholder='The number of countries to show'),
        #FormActions(Submit('graph', 'Graph', css_class='btn-primary col-sm-offset-2'))
        FormActions(Submit('graph', 'Graph'))
    )
fields.form_page:
